comparison_sdg: The time series is compliant with the UN metadata.
indicator_name: Number of victims of human trafficking per 100,000 population, by sex, age and form of exploitation
target_name: End abuse, exploitation, trafficking and all forms of violence against and torture of children
un_designated_tier_url_alert: der Statistischen Division der Vereinten Nationen
un_custodian_agency: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC)
goal_meta_link_alert: the Statistical Devision of the UN
source_organisation_1: Federal Criminal Police Office
source_url_text_1: National Situation Report on Human Trafficking and exploitation (only available in German)
source_organisation_2: Federal Statistical Office (Destatis)
source_url_text_2b: Population data based on Census 2011 – 1991 to 2011 (only available in German)

footer_fields.label: Notes
footer_fields.value:
• For recorded victims, the year of the offence can also be before the reporting year (outgoing statistics). Persons who were recorded as victims more than once in the reporting year are counted more than once accordingly.
• Labor exploitation: Conclusion of two major caseses in 2022.

footer_fields.label: Notes
footer_fields.value:
• For recorded victims, the year of the offence can also be before the reporting year (outgoing statistics). Persons who were recorded as victims more than once in the reporting year are counted more than once accordingly.
• Labor exploitation: Conclusion of two major caseses in 2022.
• In contrast to the police crime statistics (PKS), the average population is used to calculate the number of victims per 100,000 inhabitants instead of the population as of 31 December of the previous year.
• For 2010, the population was calculated backwards using the 2011 census and migration, birth and death statistics.

goal_meta_national_link_text: Metadata on the presented time series
